embeds.title: Prepare Crush
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :energy_champ: / Boss / Downfall

Gain 10 (15) **Block** :p_block:.
Next turn, gain :energy_champ: :energy_champ: :energy_champ: and SLIME CRUSH.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: excellent card, always a good pick when you don't have another boss card you need more

it's pretty good
fairly large block this turn, next turn you get heavy attack
hell, you could even just use the extra energy next turn on your own cards
very useful

I dont even use the attack a lot of the time, +3 energy is pretty good. Some characters can take advantage of the attack too. mostly notably snecko can muddle it to always reduce its cost. Slime boss can duplicate it or exhaust it and gain 4 licks. Hexaghosts preminition can play it for 1 energy and gremlins can reduce its cost to 0 with sharpen blades and then even duplicate it.
<slime crush>

embeds.title: SLIME CRUSH!!!
embeds.description:
Special Attack / 4 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Deal 35 (40) damage (to ALL enemies).
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: <premonition>

Play the chosen card and **Exhaust** it.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: its only 5 damage short of a sentry kill in act one and with a forge potion it kills all of them
costs 0 when upgraded
guardian cannot stasis this card anymore unfortunately.  Champ and automation have better attacks to play most of the time (but they do like the energy)
wait they cannot?
they can, just not with future plans
oh
that's what I thought
out of all the boss cards, i think this one feels the best, although strength-wise you could argue it's just below you are mine/shockwave
frontload 10 block for safety while you wait for the big payoff
I think this version of the card is better then the rare slime boss one
yeah, i'm seeing a trend that most of these boss cards are better than the actual boss's counterparts lol
like slimebosses version needs to be upgraded and getting 3 strength only really pays off in bosses and its a rare card
on a character that has so many good rares already its sorta underwhelming to take
also the slime boss version doesn't give the block
speaking of the upgrade, this boss card had to be nerfed lmao
it no longer gives upgraded crush
Yeah so the only way of getting back aoe crush is via forge pot or in combat upgrading
Only slime bosses card has the base opportunity of AOE
Still this card is very very good as it pairs block for the current turn as well as making your next turn much more impactful because of the extra energy
And the attack of course

of all the downfall card, this is the one that I most need to recheck the effects of every time I obtain it. The boss version and the character version are different, I think that one relic that gives you a free one might be different again, and then the packmaster gets a different version too
but literally every version is a good card
the free one gives you <prepare>

embeds.title: YOU ARE MINE!
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :PackmasterEnergy: / The Packmaster / Pack: Downfall

Apply 2 **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable: and  (2 **Weak** :p_weak:, and) remove the target's **Block** :p_block:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content:
Very useful card, has a nice self contained synergy, setting you up to have a good next turn, and giving you the block you need to get to that payoff safely. 10 block for 2 energy is a little behind the curve (usually 12 with some upside), but for that small drawback, you get the huge burst of energy next turn. This card is especially good to pull from the various sources of boss cards (boss potion, tiny bowler hat, evil within, quick study, study the spire) because it's so powerful as a 0 energy play. Snecko in particular enjoys this, as muddling can make both prepare crush and the resulting slime crush very efficient.

Since it exhausts, it's largely going to serve as a front-loading tool to get you through short and medium length hallway fights safely and quickly. It's naturally going to help carry you through the early and mid game, but you will need to find scaling solutions for the late game. The slime crush is particularly useful in act 1, as that massive burst of damage is excellent into nearly all the hallway fights, and all 3 of the elites. If you are playing a character that can upgrade it from your hand (or you hold onto a blessings of the forge), the AOE upgrade is quite valuable, especially for fights like tri-sentires, gremlin leader and tri slavers. Hexaghost has stoke the fire, and snecko has wide sting and armaments, can't think of any others right now. If the price is reasonable, I would definitely consider buying one of these from an act 1 shop, especially if I still was short a few good front-loaded cards. Not usually worth buying later than that unless you have good synergies.

Obviously great with snecko eye (though the slime crush won't have it's cost randomized), and can be great with runic pyramid to time the block and energy gain for important turns. You would rarely bother with the upgrade since it exhausts, but the +5 is really good and increases that natural self synergy.
